data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Title.Part1
data.value: Learning Outcome Formulation:

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Title.Part2
data.value: Input Support

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Info.Text
data.value: In the context of competency-based higher education and the associated shift in perspective from "teaching to learning", learning objectives have also come into focus. Learning objectives are also the most precise description of the desired learning outcomes. Learning outcomes describe what students should know and be able to do at the end of a learning section and what attitudes are expected of them. They are recorded in writing and communicated in a situational manner. The what-whereby-what-for-structure and taxonomy of learning objectives (e.g. according to Anderson & Krathwohl) are helpful in this context, to select appropriate verbs for formulating learning outcomes on the basis of different levels of competence.

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Button.Create
data.value: Create

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.TaxonomyLevel.NotSpecified
data.value: Not specified

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.TaxonomyLevel
data.value: Taxonomy Level

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.TaxonomyLevel.Info
data.value: The formulation of a learning outcome focuses on the description of corresponding competencies of the intended learning process of the students. These can be assigned to a taxonomy level based on the complexity of the cognitive processes. The definition of a taxonomy level (according to Anderson & Krathwohl) serves to find a suitable action verb in the further processing steps of the learning outcome formulation.

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Intro
data.value: You are able to...

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.VerbOfVisibility
data.value: Action Verb*

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.VerbOfVisibility.Info
data.value: The learning outcome describes desired behavioral dispositions and which abilities, skills or competencies the students will have developed at the end of the learning process. It therefore describes actions that are formulated with the help of verbs of external visibility. These represent an action on or with an external object. Verbs such as "understand" or "recognize" are therefore not suitable. The verbs of external visibility can be assigned to a taxonomy level.

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.VerbOfVisibility.Placeholder
data.value: Formulate or select

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.VerbOfVisibility.RequiredError
data.value: Specification of the verb is necessary

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.What.RequiredError
data.value: Specification of "What" is necessary

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.What.Placeholder
data.value: Text field

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.What
data.value: What? (Topic)*

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.What.Info
data.value: The "What" specifies the learning content (subject matter) that is addressed as part of the students' competency development. Combined with an action verb and the corresponding taxonomy level, it describes a competency that students should have developed by the end of the learning process.

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Whereby.Placeholder
data.value: Text field

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Whereby.Text
data.value: by...

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Whereby
data.value: Whereby?

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Whereby.Info
data.value: The "Whereby" describes the theoretical or practical tools that students use to carry out their actions. These might include formulas, models, plans, concepts, tools, etc., that are taught during the course and practiced through application. The use and integration of these tools provide the foundation for competent actions.

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.WhatFor.Placeholder
data.value: Text field

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.WhatFor.Text
data.value: to...

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.WhatFor.Info
data.value: The "What for" provides insight into the purpose and intention behind the learning unit. It emphasizes the practical applications that students will have once they have mastered the material. The "What for" illustrates the actions or opportunities students will be able to engage in, often in more complex environments and under more challenging conditions than those found in the learning situation. The “What for” does not refer to the examination.

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.WhatFor
data.value: What for?

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Text
data.value: 1. First, think about the taxonomy level at which you want to formulate your learning outcome.

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Preview
data.value: Preview of the formulated learning outcome:

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Reset
data.value: Reset entries

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Required
data.value: * Required

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.TaxonomyLevel.Remember
data.value: Accessing relevant knowledge in long-term memory

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Example
data.value: Example of a learning outcome formulation

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.TaxonomyLevel.Create
data.value: Assemble elements into a coherent structure or pattern

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.TaxonomyLevel.Understand
data.value: Assign meaning to information (oral, written or graphic) in the learning unit

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.TaxonomyLevel.Apply
data.value: Apply a course of action or a method in a specific situation

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.TaxonomyLevel.Analyse
data.value: Break down learning content into its elements and determine their connection to an overarching structure or purpose

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.TaxonomyLevel.Evaluate
data.value: Make judgments based on criteria or standards

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Button.Edit
data.value: Update

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.QualityCheck.Title
data.value: Quality Check

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.QualityCheck.Subtitle
data.value: Reflection questions to check high-quality formulated learning outcomes:

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.QualityCheck.One
data.value: Are the students the real protagonists in the plot?

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.QualityCheck.Two
data.value: Is the process of the activity understandable to an outsider?

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.QualityCheck.Three
data.value: Do the verbs describe an action performed on/with an external learning object?

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.QualityCheck.Four
data.value: Can the statement be turned into a clear assessment task?

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.QualityCheck.Five
data.value: Is the workload of the learning process appropriate?

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.QualityCheck.Six
data.value: Are the theoretical or practical tools for the task identified?

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.QualityCheck.Seven
data.value: Is the purpose of the learning unit clearly communicated?

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcome.Text.Two
data.value: 2. Now formulate a learning outcome.

data.name: CreateEditStructuredLearningOutcomeInternal.FormattedOutcome.1
data.value: [What?]
